name: Tawur Kesanga Caka 1944
description:
Sasih Kesanga is the ninth month of every Saka Year, also called Sasih Butha (Month of Butha), which means the right time to do Butha Yadnya.

On the night of Sasih Kesanga (to night 3/2/2022 GMT+8) Balinese Hindus carry out the Tawur Kesanga ceremony to celebrate Caka New Year 1944 with parade of statues which made from organic materials called Ogoh-ogoh which will be burned after the parade ends. 

Ogoh-ogoh is believed to function to expel Bhuta Kala/negative energy before Nyepi (Silence Day) on the next day 3/3/2022)
